message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.CV, cs.DS

This paper is likely to belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category as it introduces a new learning paradigm called eXtreme Regression (XR) for large-scale ranking and recommendation applications. It also proposes a new algorithm called XReg for efficient training and prediction. 

It is also likely to belong to the information retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category as it specifically focuses on Dynamic Search Advertising (DSA) and proposes a labelwise prediction algorithm for recommendation tasks. 

The paper may also be relevant to the natural language processing (cs.CL) sub-category as DSA involves processing and understanding user queries and matching them with relevant ads. 

Computer vision (cs.CV) may also be a relevant sub-category as XR can potentially be applied to image and video ranking tasks. 

Finally, the paper may be relevant to the data structures and algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category as it proposes a hierarchical decomposition of the XR task into smaller regression problems for efficient training and prediction.
